meanings.definition: Lacking originality or freshness; stale or overused.
meanings.sent1: The story felt trite and uninteresting.
meanings.sent2: The trite dialogue made the movie predictable.
meanings.sent3: His trite excuse for being late was that he got stuck in traffic.
meanings.sent4: The trite melody echoed through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent5: The trite decorations at the party made it forgettable.

meanings.sent1: The trite plot of the movie was easily predictable.
meanings.sent2: Her trite jokes always made everyone groan.
meanings.sent3: The trite catchphrase became a running joke among friends.
meanings.sent4: The trite ending left the audience disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The trite costume made her blend in with the crowd.

meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, he felt trite and drained.
meanings.sent2: The trite old shoes had holes in them.
meanings.sent3: The trite engine sputtered and died on the highway.
meanings.sent4: Her trite voice showed signs of fatigue.
meanings.sent5: The trite pen ran out of ink in the middle of the exam.
